text: The maasai tribe of East African speaks ...... language among the Nilotic family of African tribes.
explanation: Maa is one of the languages of the Nilotic tribe, other languages include Kanuri, Fur, Songhay, Nobiin and so on.

text: The policy of assimilation fails in French colony mainly due to _________

options.C: no respect for the peoples opinion

explanation: The French policy of assimilation has no regard for the people's culture unlike the indirect rule system of British in West Africa.

text: __________ were the first set of people to land on the present day Nigeria territory for trading activities.
explanation: The Portuguese were the first to do so, establishing trade with the Benin kingdom, Lagos and other regions along the coast.

text: The _________ wield the administrative power over other Yoruba land in 19th century.
explanation: The Oyo empire was a vast empire/territory, which happens to be the most popular and outstanding of all empires or kingdoms in Yoruba political system.

text: The Benin kingdom is stratified into three age grades which are
explanation: In Benin kingdom, land is owned by the villages and each village is divided into three grades which are Irogbae ( between age 0-16), Igbele ( unmarried people that form part of warriors) Edion ( old people who has achieved status in the society).

text: The method of tax collection introduced by the warrant chiefs in the Eastern Nigeria brought about __________
explanation: Prior to the advent of British domination, the Igbo society is acephalous in nature and has no clear-cut government. The warrant chief system which was later introduced to them (Igbo) brought panic, part of which is the Aba women riot of 1929/30.

text: Egyptian nationalism in late 18th century and early 20th century majorly aimed at ________

options.B: turning out military dictatorship in Egypt

explanation: Egypt, who finally got her independence in 1922 in her 19th century was seen fighting colonialism through her nationalists to ensure independence.

text: The Emir of Sokoto controls the ________ empire as one of the supreme headquarter.
explanation: The sokoto caliphate was one of the two supreme headquarter, it controls the Eastern empire and headed by an Emir. The Eastern empire include Yauri.

text: One main factor that led to depopulation of Nigerians around 1715 to 1789 was?
explanation: Depopulation is the destruction or expulsion of inhabitants from their land. The Trans-Atlantic slave trade brought depopulation to numbers of Nigeria inhabitants in 18th century.

text: The establishment of _________ by ______ help fast track the activity of nationalist in Nigeria
explanation: Herbert Macaulay Olayinka Samuel was a Nigerian politician and generally referred to as father of Nigeria nationalism, he established the first newspaper in Nigeria in 1923 called Lagos daily news

text: The first capital of Kanem-Bornu was located at ________
explanation: Kanem-Bornu was probably founded around the mid-9th century, and it's first capital was at Njimi, northern-east of the lake.

text: The 1959 general election was between three political parties which at the time were
explanation: The three (3) main political parties that participated in the 1959 election were AG, NCNC and NPC, there was no clear winner, making NCNC form coalition government with NPC leaving AG as watchdog.

text: __________ was who formed the name Nigeria after the amalgamation of Southern protectorate and Northern protectorate.
explanation: Flora Shaw who was a journalist, and later became the wife of the first governor - general of Nigeria, gave the name to Nigeria due to the Niger river that pass across the land.

text: Most Omani belongs to ________ muslim faith and are regarded as the followers of the Abdullah Ibn Ibad
explanation: Oman is the only country in the muslim world with an Ibadi-Majority population.

text: Before the fall of apartheid and expansion of franchise to all residents of the country, Nelson Mandela was imprisoned for
explanation: Nelson Mandela was imprisoned in 1962, and subsequently sentenced to a life imprisonment for conspiring to overthrow the state. Mandela served 27 years in Jail.

text: The trans-Atlantic slave trade was displace with search for raw materials by the British due to ___________
explanation: Due to the need for raw material (industrial revolution), the slave business was suppressed.

text: The spread of Islam across East Africa was a major impact of the _________
explanation: Omani is a country on the southwest coast of the Arabian peninsula in Western Asia. Their (Oman) major influence was the spread of Islam in East Africa.

text: The second military coup d' e tat in Nigeria took place on
explanation: The July coup, or the so called 'July Rematch' was the second of the many military coups in Nigeria

text: One of the following is generally referred to as the first executive president in Nigeria
explanation: President Shehu Shagari became the first executive president in Nigeria after being successfully handed power to by the Olusegun Obasanjo military regime.

text: The Mahdist rebel against the Egyptian authority was a success due to

options.B: A fight back from every citizen

explanation: Due to the widespread support of the Mahdist revolt, it became successful at the end from Egyptian rule.

text: Nigeria became the ________ member of United nation organization in 1960.
explanation: United Nation Organization created in 1945, which foster on world peace and security has 193 members including Nigeria, who was her 99th.

text: Sierra Leone finally got freedom from the British colonial domination in ________
explanation: Sierra Leone, one of the British west Africa colony, got her independence on 27th April, 1961 under the leadership of Sir Milton Margai who became their first prime minister.

text: _________ led to the European merchant agenda for imperialism and smooth penetration of Nigeria

options.A: The need to extend christianity in Africa
options.B: Abolition of slave trade and the need for raw materials.
options.D: Need to help Nigeria become federation

explanation: Abolition of slave trade cause the British capitalist to exploit foreign countries in order to get raw material to develop their industry.

text: One of these is not a social development under colonial rule.
explanation: Exploitation is a negative impact of colonialism e.g Lever Brothers took over the Niger company in 1929, they became heirs to one of the most notorious explorers of the 19th century African.

text: The Muslim reform movement have grown due to inspiration from all the following except
explanation: The movement have often been inspired by North Africans, Arabs or in some cases, Indo-Pakistani traditions of reform, such as the salafiya of Muhammed Abduh.

text: The support of the Felahin helps Mohammed Ali ___________
explanation: Fellahin are native peasants or labourer, mostly farmers or agricultural labourers in the middle east and north Africa, they supported Mohammed Ali gain effective control of Egypt.

text: The protectorate of Nigeria in 1914 became _________ in 1946
explanation: Protectorates in 1914 became regions in 1946, under Arthur Richard constitution.

text: Ethiopia's lowlands and high plateau protected the country from ___________
explanation: Ethiopia is located on a semi - desert lowlands, valleys and gorges which protected the country from foreign invasion.

text: One of the following is not a gearing factor towards the great trek.

options.B: Bringing back to normal the economic, cultural and political independence
options.C: The panic that emigration might decline civilization
options.D: The fear of conflict on the eastern frontier of South Africa

explanation: The Dutch reformed church was in opposition to great trek, seeing it also as being an act of godlessness

text: The decrease of Boer influence in South Africa was as a result of
explanation: Mfecane was the period of widespread chaos and warfare among indigenous ethnic communities in South Africa

text: The main economic activity of the Nupe people is
explanation: The Nupe people are called different name by various tribe in Nigeria, e.g Yoruba refer them as Takpa. The Nupe are noted throughout Nigeria for glass beads, fine leather and mat work, brass trays, and fine cloth.

text: The crown colony system is ________

options.A: a form of British direct rule of British annexed territory
options.B: the home of the queen for admin purpose
options.C: where all the African countries are administered
options.D: the seat for traditional rulers playing indirect rule

explanation: The crown colony system is British annexed territories in which the British established political institution such as the executive council, legislative council and so on

text: The Murtala/Obasanjo's regime _________

options.A: had a programme called war against discipline
options.B: was the pioneered of the structural adjustment programme
options.C: favoured decolonization and self determination of Africa states

explanation: The regime favours decolonization, a case in point was event in Angola where the regime support MPLA, Augustino Neto's popular movement for the liberation of Angola from UNITA.

text: The Efik serve as ___________ between the white trader on the coast and the inland tribes of Cross river.
explanation: The Efik were the middle men between the white traders on the coast and the inland tribes of the Cross river and Calabar district.

text: United Nation Organization emerge as a result of collapse of ____________
explanation: League of Nations was created in 1919 to prevent the outbreak of another world war after that of 1914-18.

text: The mid western region was created out of the ___________ in 1963.
explanation: The Mid western region was created in 1963 out of the existing western region, and later in 1976 known as the Bendel state

text: The discovery of Terracotta in 1928 on NOK soil in Kaduna state was by?
explanation: The Terracotta was accidentally unearthed at a level of 24 feet from an alluvial tin mine.

text: The three existing groups before the creation of Organizations of Africa Unity in 1963 were __________
explanation: These were the former blocs that were existing before the creation of Organization of Africa Unity on May 25, 1963 with headquarters at Addis Abbaba.

text: The first Africa to be ordained bishop by the Christian missionary school in addition to consecration as bishop of the Niger territory is ___________
explanation: Ajayi Crowther was a captured slave at age 12 by the fulani slave raiders and sold to Portuguese slave traders, he later regained his freedom and became first to be ordained Bishop.

text: The strained relationship between Nigeria and Britain during Murtala/Obasanjo's regime in 1975 led to ________

options.C: nationalisation of British petroleum and Barclays bank
options.D: nationalisation of cocoa house in Ibadan

explanation: The correct answer is - the nationalisation of British petroleum and Barclays bank. Due to the support Nigeria gave MPLA, Augustino Neto's popular movement for liberation of Angola against UNITA, there was a strain reaction from Britain and some other western countries.

text: In whose regime was illegal West Africa aliens living in Nigeria expelled?
explanation: About one million illegal aliens were expelled in 1975, the land borders were closed to check smuggling and the inflow of illegal immigrants.

text: The Abacha's regime adopted a _______ posture with the international organizations.
explanation: The Abacha's administration is accused of abuse of human rights, and subsequently sanctions were clamped down on the country from the west and the member nations of commonwealth etc.

text: _______ who was the minister of defence staff of the republic of Biafra, formally renounced the existence of the state in 1970.
explanation: The Nigeria civil war started on July 6, 1967 and come to an end on January 15, 1970 when Philip Effiong ceased fire with Yakubu gowon.

text: One of the following is regarded as the founding father of the Kanuri?
explanation: The old Nupe kingdom was established in the middle of 15th century in a basin between the Niger and Kaduna river, in what is now central Nigeria and the legendary founder of Nile is Ali Ghaji.

text: The regional south Africa in Africa comprises of _________ countries.
explanation: South Africa is one of the 5 regions of Africa. South Africa is then further subdivided into 11 independent countries which include Republic of South Africa.

text: Portuguese speaking countries in Africa who were formerly colonized by Portugal are generally refer to as____________
explanation: A Busophone country is that which was formerly colonized by Portugal and speaks Portuguese as her official language, E.g Carpe Verde, Guinea Bissau and Mozambique.

text: The method of order used by Europeans to take over the present day Nigeria is________

options.C: Trader, colonialist, indirect rule and freedom

explanation: Most European groups that came to Nigeria started as an explorer, then later trading with the locals, and sometimes after missionaries set in and finally the imperialists motive ( Foreigners dominating domestic economic).

text: Once an empty calabash is send out by the Bashorun to an unconstitutional Alaafin on behalf of the Oyomesis, such Alaafin has to ________
explanation: An empty calabash could be sent by Bashorun ( leader of Oyomesi) to Alaafin who has acted unconstitutional, this message authorize such Alaafin to commit suicide.

text: Every citizens of Benin kingdom is an Oba's subject and were regarded as ________
explanation: The political organization of the Benin kingdom (Bini) sees Oba as a mighty leader, who all citizens are subjected to.

text: The Clifford constitution is considered as a landmark in Nigeria history, because it ________

options.B: recognized Lagos as a federal territory
options.D: Pave way for the office of Prime minister

explanation: Clifford constitution for the first time established elective principle, this is that, election was conducted into the legislative council.

text: North Africa according to United Nation Classification comprises of how many countries.
explanation: The UN sub - region of North Africa consist of 7 countries which are Algeria, Egypt, Libya, Morocco, Sudan, Tunisia, Western Sahara.

text: One of the following majorly influence the success of Sokoto jihad

options.B: lack of Unity among Hausa states
options.C: the mighty men of the Jihadist

explanation: The Sokoto jihad which happened in 1804, was a success mainly because of lack of unity among the Hausa state. Othman Dan Folio, the leader of the war then established the Sokoto caliphate with outstanding centralize political system.

text: The South-Eastern part of Nigeria was _________ in its political system before the advent of colonialism.
explanation: The south-eastern part of Nigeria also know as Igbo society is an highly decentralized administration, in other words, they didn't have a single ruler or overall ruler administering the community

text: One but all are factors that lead to growth of nationalism in Nigeria.
explanation: All the answers except option D gave rise to Nigeria nationalism to stand up as one against British Colonial rule.

text: ____________ played a prominent role in the government of the Kanem-Borno empire.
explanation: Magira, queen mother alongside Gumsu ( Mai's first wife) performed important activities in the palace and they trained the princes. They are great influence in the politics of the empire.

text: ___________ constitution gave full blown to federalism in Nigeria.
explanation: The Oliver Lyttleton constitution of 1954 grant Nigeria a formal and well recognised federal structure, this is that the power of the country is well decentralized as it should properly be.

text: Lagos was annexed and became British colony in _________
explanation: Lagos, now part of the Southern Nigeria was annexed on 6th of August 1861 under the treat of force by Commander Beddingfield of HMS Prometheus, who was accompanied by the acting British consul, William's McCoskry.

text: The main party against apartheid party in South African was the __________
explanation: The ANC was formed on 8th January, 1912, and has fight against apartheid with all its power, it has been the ruling party of post-apartheid South Africa since election of Nelson Mandela in the 1994 election.

text: All but one is not impact of British on Nigeria.
explanation: The Islamic law also known as Sharia law, is a Muslim law and was introduced to the northerners of Nigeria by Arabs even before the advent of British domination.

text: The Scramble of Africans by Europeans in 1884/85 Berlin Conference made Nigeria a British _________ colony.
explanation: Nigeria is one of the British west African colonies, others include Ghana, Gambia, and Sierra Leone.

text: Before 1963 __________ was the highest court in Nigeria
explanation: The Supreme court become the highest court in 1963, but before then, the Privy council in London sees to dispute settlement and matters adjudication.

text: The Coup that took Shehu Shagari out from office was a __________ coup.
explanation: President Shehu Shagari was removed from office through palace coup by Mohammed Buhari on January 1, 1983.

text: The Mahdist state or Sudanese Mahdiyya, was a _________ movement launched in 1881.
explanation: The Sudanese Mahdiyyaq is a religious and political movement by Muhammad Ahmed bin Abdullah (later Muhammad al-Mahdi) against the Khediavate of Egypt, which had ruled the Sudan since 1821.

text: The Nigeria president who with Eyadema of Togo spearhead the formation of ECOWAS is ___________
explanation: The Economic Community of West Africa State (ECOWAS) founded on 28th May, 1975 in Lagos was spearheaded by President Eyadema of Togo and Yakubu Gowon of Nigeria.

text: Freetown was use to facilitate ________ from 1822 to early 20th century.
explanation: Freetown, was founded as home for repatriated former slaves in 1787, it has a special significance in the history of the trans-Atlantic slave trade as a departure point for thousands of West African captives.

text: __________ is the economic control and exploitation of foreign lands arising from necessity to reverse the impediment to the accumulation of capital.
explanation: Imperialism is an outward drive of certain people to build empires, colonies and to occupy privileges position in market of foreign lands.

text: Due to colonialism, the new day Nigeria now has _______as her official language.
explanation: English became the official language of Nigeria since colonial period and this has helped the country stay unified. It (English) gave the people better social interaction despite the diverse of cultures in the land.

text: The point where the recent and earlier Islamic reform movement relate is the __________

options.A: use of Arabic language as strict medium
options.B: support of holy Quran translation to African languages
options.C: decline in the use of educational resources institutes
options.D: need for terrorist group to take over world on Islamic ground

explanation: The recent and earlier Islamic movement actively support the translation of the holy text into Swahili, Hausa, Fulfude, Wolof, Bambara and Yoruba.

text: ___________ was the governor of the protectorate of Lagos and Southern Nigeria in 1906.
explanation: Sir Walter Egerton had a long career in the administration of British empire, holding senior position which included the governorship of Lagos colony and southern Nigeria in 1906.

text: The main reason Liberia and Ethiopia was not colonised is

options.A: The former is a strong country with thriving empire while the later is a country for freed American slave.
options.B: The latter is a strong country with thriving empire while the former is a country for freed American slave.
options.C: The former is a Christian made nation while the latter is a mixed giving it freedom from colonial lord
options.D: The latter surrender fast while the former surrender later

explanation: The Italian had attempted many times to colonize Ethiopia, but all attempts failed due to Ethiopia military strength and location, while Liberia was formed as a home for freed American slaves

text: The expansion of white communities in South Africa is a major cause of ________
explanation: The great trek starting in 1836 in southern Africa, was a mass migration of Dutch-speaking inhabitants of British run Cape colony, who left the Cape and travelled eastward by wagon train to the interior of the continent to live beyond the reach of British colonial rule.

text: Mfecane in South Africa happened between ____________
explanation: Mfecane happened in Southern Africa during the period between 1815 to 1840, thus, easing the way for white expansion into Natal and the Highveld.

text: One of the following is not feature of the traditional economic activities of the Yoruba people.
explanation: The Yoruba people are the current south-west inhabitant in Nigeria, they are popularly known for their farming lifestyle among other things.

text: Lagos colony and protectorate of southern Nigeria was merge merged together to form ____________

options.B: Lagos colony and protectorate of southern Nigeria

explanation: For British administration of current day Nigeria to move fast, they gradually amalgamate the three different administrative units, starting with Lagos colony and protectorate of southern Nigeria.

text: The first regime to successfully transfer power back to civil rule was
explanation: Murtala/Obasanjo was the first to successfully transfer power back to civilian in 1979 after the constitution drafting committee, headed by chief Rotimi Williams, submitted the drafted constitution to the president and has been reviewed by the constituent assembly, headed by Justice Udo Udomma.

text: The Efik are primarily located in _________
explanation: The Efik are sub-ethnic group of Ibibio located primarily in southern Nigeria, in the southern part of Cross River state

text: One of these is not an organ of Organisation of Petroleum exporting countries.
explanation: The General Assembly is an of organ of the United Nations and not of the Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC).

text: The completion of the 36 states in Nigeria was done by ____________ in __________ year
explanation: The completion of 36 state in Nigeria was by Abacha on October 1, 1996.

text: The civilization of NOK people depict

options.A: The different stages of development in Nigeria

explanation: The NOK, through archaeological research has pass through early, middle and late stone age as well as well as stone age.

text: The fast spread of Christianity in Nigeria is associated with
explanation: After the abolition of slave trade in 1833 by Britain, many were freed to sierra leone and some trace their root back to Nigeria, they also had opportunity to acquire education offered by the Church Missionary Society (CMS)
